page.title: 15Harpenden Day Centre
page.content:
Visiting the Day Centre in Harpenden we found comfortable rooms furnished from money raised by local people. It is open daily to pensioners and the physically handicapped who live in Harpenden. They meet for a chat over coffee, lunch and tea. 135 meals are cooked by paid kitchen staff daily. The Red Cross also prepare 'Meals on Wheels' for 90 people. Apart from kitchen and cleaning staff all help is voluntary. A hairdresser and chiropodist visit and have special prices and we saw one lady having her hair set. Harpenden Library provide books and many Clubs meet weekly.
Next to the Centre is a home for 37 pensioners (aged 80-84 years) built on land left by local 17th century benefactor James Marshall.
